terms.definition: A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a provider and accessed via the internet
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions
A single, unified location where all documentation, files, and resources are stored and managed for easy access and consistency
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously work on and edit the same document with changes visible instantly to all participants
Documentation frameworks that use predefined formats and structures to standardize document creation and ensure consistency
The ability to access software, documents, and data through internet-connected servers rather than local computer storage
Work groups composed of members from different departments or specialties who collaborate on shared projects or objectives
The process of ensuring that documentation and processes meet industry standards, legal requirements, and government regulations
The systematic process and sequence of steps involved in creating, reviewing, approving, and maintaining documentation
The process of connecting different software tools and systems so they can work together and share data seamlessly
A chronological record of document changes, access, and activities that provides accountability and supports compliance requirements
Pre-designed document formats that ensure consistency in structure, formatting, and required information across an organization
The measure of how well an organization uses its resources to produce desired outcomes with minimal waste of time, effort, or materials
A comprehensive software environment that provides the foundation and tools for creating, managing, and delivering applications or services
